text: The Hungarian Football Federation (, MLSZ) is the governing body of football in Hungary. It organizes the Hungarian league and the Hungarian national team. It is based in Budapest. György Szepesi was president of the Hungarian Football Association from 1978 to 1986. ==Honours== ;National Team * World Cup: 15px Runner-up (2 times - 1938, 1954) * Olympic Games: 15px Winner (3 times - 1952, 1964, 1968); 15px Runner-up (2 times - 1972); 15px Third place (1 time - 1960) ;National Youth Teams * FIFA U-20 World Cup: 15px Third place (1): 2009 ==Divisions== ;Men's *Hungary national football team *Hungary national under-21 football team *Hungary national under-19 football team *Hungary national under-17 football team *Hungary national under-16 football team *Hungary national futsal team *Hungary national beach soccer team ;Women's *Hungary women's national football team *Hungary women's national under-19 football team *Hungary women's national under-17 football team ===Current head coaches=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Men's Team ! Women's Team ! Name |- | National team | Edina Markó |- | Under-19 team | Sándor Turtóczki |- | Under-17 team | Dorottya Schumi |} == Competitions == Magyar Labdarúgó Szövetség is responsible for organising the following competitions: ===Men's football=== *Nemzeti Bajnokság I (Tier 1) *Nemzeti Bajnokság II (Tier 2) *Nemzeti Bajnokság III (Tier 3) – three sections (East, Central, West) ===Women's football=== *Nemzeti Bajnokság I (women) (Tier 1) *Nemzeti Bajnokság II (women) (Tier 2) – two sections (East, West) ===Cups=== *Magyar Kupa – Men *Magyar Kupa (women) – Women ===Futsal=== *Nemzeti Bajnokság I (Tier 1) *Magyar Kupa – Men *Nemzeti Bajnokság I (women) (Tier 1) *Magyar Kupa (women) – Women ===Beach soccer=== *Nemzeti Strandlabdarúgó Liga (Tier 1) ==Hungarian Football Federation Player of the Year== As awarded by the HFF In 1980 the title was not awarded. *In 1949, 1950 and 1963 the title was awarded to two players. {| class="wikitable" |- |align=center style="background- color:#faecc8"|
